subject: Investing
title: How Stock Prices Move
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Stock Prices Move.

hook.text: A stock's price changes every second. It rises when more people want to buy than sell. Simple as that.

buildup.text: Supply and demand set every price. Good earnings news increases demand. Bad news triggers selling.

discovery.text: In the short term, prices reflect emotions â€” fear, greed, hype. In the long term, they follow earnings.

twist.text: A stock can drop 20% on zero news. Sometimes a large fund just needs to sell, and price absorbs it.

climax.text: Benjamin Graham said the market is a voting machine short-term and a weighing machine long-term.

punchline.text: Prices reflect mood today and value eventually.

quiz.question: What primarily drives stock prices in the long term?
